posts.title: Managing migration grief
posts.excerpt: Feeling sad when moving is normal. Discover how to navigate this process.
posts.content:
Migration grief is a natural psychological process that occurs when we move from one country to another. It is not just the loss of a physical place, but of a support network, a social role, and a cultural identity. At 'Como en casa', we help you understand that feeling sad, disoriented, or even irritable is part of the journey. 

To navigate it healthily, it is vital to allow yourself to feel these emotions without judgment. Maintaining contact with your roots while building new bridges in your destination is the balance we seek. Remember: you didn't leave to suffer, you left to grow, and growth sometimes hurts.

posts.title: Routines for nomads
posts.excerpt: How to maintain mental health when your office changes every week.
posts.content:
Digital nomad life promises freedom, but it can be a challenge for our emotional stability. Without clear routines, the brain can enter a state of constant alert. Establishing a 'mental survival kit' is essential: a defined work schedule, moments of total digital disconnection, and the search for local communities, even if only for a short time.

In our sessions, we work on creating emotional anchors that do not depend on a specific geographic location. Your home is not an address, it is you.

posts.title: Online therapy: Does it work?
posts.excerpt: Everything you need to know about the effectiveness of video sessions.
posts.content:
Numerous studies show that online therapy is as effective as face-to-face therapy for most psychological disorders. The key lies in the therapeutic bond. Video calls eliminate geographical barriers and allow people with high mobility, such as digital nomads, to maintain a continuity that was previously impossible.

The comfort of your own space and schedule flexibility are competitive advantages that reduce dropout rates and increase commitment to the therapeutic process.
